    • insertTileLMR

      void insertTileLMR(int tileIndex, int row, int col, int rotation, String playerNickname) throws Exception
      Inserts a tile into the game board at the specified location with the given rotation. This method is used to place a tile on the board during the game and associates it with the player who initiated the action.
      Specified by:
      insertTileLMR in interface VirtualView
      Parameters:
      tileIndex - The index of the tile being placed, typically corresponding to its identifier in the tile set.
      row - The row position on the board where the tile will be inserted.
      col - The column position on the board where the tile will be inserted.
      rotation - The rotation of the tile, which determines its orientation. The value is typically in degrees or a format recognized by the game logic.
      playerNickname - The nickname of the player performing the tile placement.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the tile placement is invalid or an error occurs during insertion.
